alert.note: Alert for Pike; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 11:19PM EDT until March 28 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers... Scioto River at Piketon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Scioto River at Piketon. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Backwater flooding occurs along creeks flowing into the Scioto River. Scioto and Camp Creek Townships in southern Pike County experience flooding. Flood waters spillS onto low-lying county roads near the Scioto River in Pike and northern Scioto Counties, with State route 220 near River Road flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 18.6 feet and rising - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.4 feet Monday morning. It should then fall below flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
